Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Resource::Resource ( std::vector< std::string >  attributes,
std::vector< std::string >  values 
)

One of two Resource constructors. This constructor is called when receiving new resource during runtime, because it does not take ID as an argument.

Resource::Resource ( std::vector< std::string >  attributes,
std::vector< std::string >  values,
int  theID 
)

One of two Resource constructors. This constructor is called when loading resources from file, because it takes the resource ID stored on file as an argument.

Member Function Documentation

void Resource::addAttribute ( std::string  attrName,
std::string  defValue 
)

used to add a new attribute to the resource map of values. takes in a string for new attribute name, and string for default value. no return.

std::string Resource::getAttributeValue ( std::string  attribute)

takes string denoting attribute value wanted. returns resource's value mapped to that attribute.

int Resource::getResourceId ( )

This method takes no arguments and returns an integer resource ID.

void Resource::removeAttribute ( std::string  attr)

takes in string with name of attribute to remove. removes attribute from resource map. no return.

std::string Resource::serializeValues ( std::vector< std::string >  attributes,
char  delim 
)

takes in the server's list vector of attributes and the desired delimiter. serializes all values in resource, with given delimiter between each. returns string.

int Resource::setNewValues ( std::vector< std::string >  newValues,
std::vector< std::string >  attributes 
)

used for modifying existing resources attributes. takes in vector of strings holding new values, and list of current attributes. returns int 1 for success.
